summary:
Alberto is a Spanish architect graduaded in Architecture with honour distinction in 2018 at the University of Alicante Polytechnic School. Registered architect in the Architectenregister of The Netherlands.

With four years of professional experience in Architecture, he acquired insights in Architecture, Urban planning, Urban design and Landscape design. 

In 2019 moved to Rotterdam joining the multidisciplinary architectural office’s, MASA Architects, MADMA Urbanism + Landscape, and Studio Marco Vermeulen. In 2022 joined De Architekten Cie in Amsterdam that brought him the opportunity to develop exciting projects in local and international markets. Gaining experience in mix-use developments, high-rise residential housing, accommodation buildings, high density urban developments, and office buildings.

projects:
[{'title': 'Tenerife at Home (First Price)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'First prize Spring hotels design challenge.

Tenerife at Home storytells the singular landscape of the Canary Archipelago where Tenerife island is a very important and representative part of it, starting a journey through its great landmarks; The Islands, the Volcano, Bufaderos, Oasis, Beaches, Whirlpools.... Bringing and adapting them into a new and very comfortable gently landscape, allowing every leisure activity occur “at Home” while at the same time, meeting the identity of Tenerife in a playful, unexplored and very immersive way.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alberto', 'last_name': 'Carbonell Crespí', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Architect'}]}, {'title': 'SIEIDI (Shortlisted)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Finalist Artic Hotel. 

SIEIDI is the new Landmark of Rovaniemi placed at the summit of Ounasvaara, bonding the Sky and the Finland Forest with the Finnish people and their Culture. Manifesting the legacy of the indigenous Sami art and worship to their Finnish mythology  respecting the sacred landscape of Lapland. 

The proposal prioritizes the ground level as Forest realm, juxtaposing the program of the Sieidi in two levels. Hoovering above the ground, the volume of the Hotel shelters the area inviting the wildlife approaching to the site. Maintaining a safe distance and respecting the clear boundaries between the animal and the human activities.

Underground, the Creative Hub inspires from nature, witnessing casual meetings and interactions from curious animals attracted by natural and artistic events. From the atelier performances and crafting, to the food smells and the refreshing water pond. 

The creative area acts as a white canvas, enhancing the free expression, creativity and movement of the artists with adaptable composition of the diaphanous space. Assisting the cultural exchange and promoting the flexibility between the design activities and their spaces.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alberto', 'last_name': 'Carbonell Crespí', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Architect'}]}, {'title': 'Memories of Dandelion (Second Prize)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Second prize Outer space competition.

The story proposes a method of terraforming Mars using a Satellite deflecting the solar radiation. Made-up of gigantic sparkling balloons filled with water, air and seeds to germinate the barren surface, and the first steps that humans take onto the surface without space suits" Blank Space.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alberto', 'last_name': 'Carbonell Crespí', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Architect'}]}, {'title': 'Altered Minescapes, The Land of sources (Final Thesis)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'description': 'Final thesis. Graduated with Honour Distinction at Polytechnic University of Alicante
Honourable Mention. Tamayouz Excellence Award.

Placed in Sierra Minera, Cartagena, Altered Minescapes is a project manifest approaching from symbiotic and binding perspective the full regeneration and revitalization of an old mining landscape. Abandoned and sickened due to its lack of care and bad treatment given after the full depletion of its resources.
Facing this situation, the need for reconnecting Sierra Minera with its people rises beyond its tacit healing. Focusing the effort in enabling new coexistence relations, reinterpreting the landscape and its new latent wealth, strengthening our emotional bonds with it. Achieving an optimistic and productive new post-industrial picture, changing the paradigm of mining ecosystems production, from intoxication to cleaning up processes.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Alberto', 'last_name': 'Carbonell Crespí', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Architect'}]}]
